intro: Tarenaya longicarpa, commonly known as the long-fruited tarenaya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple. Its fruit is a distinctive, elongated capsule that contains small, dark seeds. Tarenaya longicarpa is often found in wetland or riparian habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
